page.title: 12A DAY ON THE FARM
page.content: On a normal day on the farm,the farm owners get up at 7:15am and the younger members of the family get ready for school and set the table for breakfast.At 8:00am,they all have breakfast and then they clear the table.After that,they walk half a mile to the mini-bus which takes them to Melrose Grammar Primary School. At 3.45 p.m. the mini-bus brings the children home at 4.00 p.m.The older children return from Secondary School at 4.15 and they all change into old clothes. The two boys then help their dad to stack the silage in a large,or storing the wheat or barley in hoppers. Sometimes they help to stack hay.Tea is taken at 6.00 p.m. and afterwards work continues until 8.30.Supper is taken at 9.00 p.m. and the children go to bed on at 10.00
